form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Warren (for herself, Mr. Rubio, Mr. Markey, Ms. Ayotte, Mrs. Shaheen, Mr. Toomey, Mr. Brown, and Mr. Menendez) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration

form.official-title: To direct the Architect of the Capitol to place in the United States Capitol a chair honoring American Prisoners of War/Missing in Action.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National POW/MIA Remembrance Act of 2015.

paragraph.text: In recent years, commemorative chairs honoring American Prisoners of War/Missing in Action have been placed in prominent locations across the United States.
The United States Capitol is an appropriate location to place a commemorative chair honoring American Prisoners of War/Missing in Action.

section.header: Placement of a chair in the United States Capitol honoring American Prisoners of War/Missing in Action

subsection.text: The Architect of the Capitol shall enter into an agreement to obtain a chair featuring the logo of the National League of POW/MIA Families under such terms and conditions as the Architect considers appropriate and consistent with applicable law.
Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the Architect shall place the chair obtained under subsection (a) in a suitable permanent location in the United States Capitol.

accept donations of funds, property, and services to carry out the purposes of this Act.

subsection.text: All costs incurred in carrying out the purposes of this Act shall be paid for with private donations received under subsection (a).
